dialogues.text: I need a urine sample.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. It's been six months already. Can I give it to you in the morning? I just took a whiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I suppose. (an awkward beat) Well. Good night, son. He disappears down the hall. Ricky smiles, shuts and lock his door. He puts the plastic cup on the shelf, then cros to a MINI REFRIGERATOR in the corner of his room and take out a cup-sized TUPPERWARE CONTAINER from the freezer, already filled with urine, albeit frozen, and places it o saucer to thaw overnight.

dialogues.speaker: INT BURNHAM HOUSE
dialogues.text: Carolyn lies sleeping. Lester is awake, staring at the ceiling. After a moment, he gets up, taking care not to disturb Carolyn, and walks toward the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester enters and switches on the LIGHT. The room is fill with STEAM. Lester looks around, confused, then focuses o His POV: Across from us, in a PEDESTAL BATHTUB, is Angela She smiles and beckons us, and we MOVE CLOSER. ROSE PETAL float on the surface of the water, obscuring her naked bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting for you. Lester kneels by the bathtub like a man in church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been working out, haven't you? I can tell. She arches her back and looks up at him provocatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd give me a bath... I'm very, very dirty. Lester gives her a hard look, then slowly slips his hand the water between her legs. Her eyes widen and she throws head back... and we SMASH CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Carolyn, her eyes wide, listening to the rhythmi BRUSH of Lester's hand as he masturbates under the covers She flips over and faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Carolyn switches on the bedside LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were masturbating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you were. He turns to her, trying to look innocent, then gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, so shoot me. I was whacking off. Carolyn gets out of bed, repelled. Lester LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I was choking the bishop. Shaving the carrot. Saying hi to my monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, excuse me, but I still have blood pumping through my veins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I'm the only one who seems to be doing anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester. I refuse to live like this. This is not a marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hasn't been a marriage for years. But you were happy as long as I kept my mouth shut. Well, guess what? I've changed. And the new me whacks off when he feels horny, because you're obviously not going to help me out in that department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I see. You think you're the only one who's sexually frustrated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not? Well then, come on, baby! I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Do not mess with me, mister, or I will divorce you so fast it'll make your head spin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what grounds? I'm not a drunk, I don't fuck other women, I don't mistreat you, I've never hit you, or even tried to touch you since you made it so abundantly clear just how unnecessary you consider me to be. But. I did support you while you got your license. And some people might think that entitles me to half of what's yours. She sinks into a chair, stunned. It's clear he knows wher she's most vulnerable. He sees this, and likes it; it fee good to win for a change. He curls up under the covers contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn out the light when you come to bed, okay? CLOSE on Lester, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're FLYING high above the neighborhood. Below us we see two Jims, jogging. We APPROACH them steadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a great thing when you realize you still have the ability to surprise yourself. Makes you wonder what else you can do that you've forgotten about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're now at street level, FOLLOWING the two Jims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You guys! Still running, the Jims turn back in perfect unison, as Lester runs INTO FRAME, wearing a baggy sweatshirt and a of faded old sweatpants. The Jims slow down until he catc up, then the three men run together in the early morning light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester, I didn't know you ran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panting) Well, I just started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you guys might be able to give me some pointers. I need to shape up. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, are you just looking to lose weight, or do you want have increased strength and flexibility as well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to look good naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel is washing his Ford Explorer, squatting to sc the bumper, when something Catches his eye: His POV: Lester and the Jims jog down the street. The Colonel stands, scowling, as Ricky comes out of the house, holding the URINE SAMPLE in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, the fucking gay pride parade? Lester breaks off from the two Jims and jogs up to Ricky the Colonel, out of breath. He grabs hold of his knees an bends over, panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Yo! Ricky! (re: the Jims) My entire life is passing before my eyes, and those two have barely broken a sweat. He LAUGHS, and extends his hand to the Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, hi. Lester Burnham, I live next door. We haven't met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes) COLONEL Frank Fitts, U.S. Marine Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Welcome to the neighborhood, sir. He salutes the Colonel good-naturedly, grinning. The Colo doesn't think it's funny. An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Ricky, uh, I was thinking about the, uh... I was gonna... the movie we talked about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Re-Animator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to borrow it? (before Lester can answer) Okay, it's up in my room. Come on. He heads into the house. Lester waves at the Colonel, the follows him. The Colonel watches them go, his eyes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky enters, followed by Lester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hold this for a sec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. He gives the URINE SPECIMEN to Lester, then locks the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think my dad would try to come in when somebody else is here, but you never know. Ricky crosses to a bureau and opens a DRAWER. He takes clothing out and piles it on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: urine sample) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urine. I have to take a drug test every six months to make sure I'm clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? You just smoked with me last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not mine. One of my clients is a nurse in a pediatrician's office. I cut her a deal, she keeps me in clean piss. Lester picks up a CD case from a shelf and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like Pink Floyd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like a lot of music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I haven't listened to this album in years. He shakes his head, then puts the CD case down. Ricky, ha emptied the drawer, now removes a FALSE BOTTOM, revealing rows of MARIJUANA, tightly packed in ZIP-LOC BAGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, it's been a while. How much is an ounce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates bag) Well, this is totally decent, and it's three hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates another bag) But this shit is top of the line. It's called G-13. Genetically engineered by the U.S. Government. Extremely potent. But a completely mellow high, no paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what we smoked last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all I ever smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Things have changed since 1973.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to pay now. I know you're good for it. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him a bag) There's a card in there with my beeper number, call me anytime day or night. And I only accept cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around room) Well, now I know how you can afford all this equipment. When I was your age, I flipped burgers all summer just to be able to buy an eight track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No actually, it was great. All I did was party and get laid. (smiles) I had my whole life ahead of me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad thinks I pay for all this with catering jobs. (off Lester's look) Never underestimate the power of denial. Lester smiles. This kid's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn, carrying a basket of fresh cut ROSES, passes by GARAGE WINDOW. From inside the garage, we HEAR ROCK MUSIC Carolyn stops and SNIFFS the air, frowning. She peers thr the window. Her POV: Lester, in a T-shirt and gym shorts, lies on a n WEIGHT BENCH, doing bench presses with shiny new BARBELLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCK MUSIC blasts from a new BOOMBOX on the floor. The garage is in the process of becoming Lester's sanctua An ugly but comfortable 70's BOWL CHAIR has been pulled o and cleaned off, his old hot rod magazines strewn across and the remote-controlled MODEL JEEP KIT is spread across card table. The SHELVES that Lester tore through earlier been dismantled, leaving a blank wall on which now hangs DART BOARD. Lester finishes his last rep, straining, then puts the weights in their rack and sits up. As he takes a drag off joint, the GARAGE DOOR suddenly starts to open. Lester lo up, squinting at: His POV: The door raises to reveal Carolyn, silhouetted against the bright sunlight outside, pointing a REMOTE at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh, mom's mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bench presses. I'm going to wail on my pecs, and then I'm going to do my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you're smoking pot now. I'm so glad. I think using illegal psychotropic substances is a very positive example to set for our daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one to talk, you bloodless, money- grubbing freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hostile) Lester. You have such hostility in you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind? I'm trying to work out here. (then, suggestively) Unless you want to spot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not get away with this. You can be sure of that! And she's gone. Lester leans back on the bench and grabs weights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he lifts) That's. What. You. Think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brad is seated behind his desk, reading a document. Leste sits across from him, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads) "...my job consists of basically masking my contempt for the assholes in charge, and, at least once a day, retiring to the men's room so I can jerk off, while I fantasize about a life that doesn't so closely resemble hell." (looks up at Lester) Well, you obviously have no interest in saving yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Brad, for fourteen years I've been a whore for the advertising industry. The only way I could save myself now is if I start firebombing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Management wants you gone by the end of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just what sort of severance package is "management" prepared to offer me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering the information I have about our editorial director buying pussy with company money. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which I'm sure would interest the I.R.S., since it technically constitutes fraud. And I'm sure that some of our advertisers and rival publications might like to know about it as well. Not to mention, Craig's wife. Brad sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One year's salary, with benefits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you say I throw in a little sexual harassment charge to boot? Brad LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against you. Brad stops laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you prove you didn't offer to save my job if I'd let you blow me? Brad leans back in his chair, studying Lester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. You are one twisted fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) Nope. I'm just an ordinary guy with nothing to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhilarated, Lester walks down a corridor, his belongings a box on his shoulder. He's happier than he's been in yea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn sits at a table, lost in thought. There are two m on the table. After a moment, Buddy Kane, the Real Estate King, joins her. Carolyn immediately becomes warm and gracious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy. Carolyn smiles, genuinely touched that he remembers her n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry I kept you waiting. Christy left for New York this morning, and... let's just say things were very hectic around the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing in New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's moving there. (off Carolyn's look) Yes. We are splitting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Yes, according to her, I'm too focused on my career. As if being driven to succeed is some sort of character flaw. Well, she certainly knew how to take advantage of the lifestyle my success afforded her. Oh. Wow. (then, laughing) Ah, it's for the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I saw you two at the party the other night, you seemed perfectly happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, call me crazy, but it is my philosophy that in order to be successful, one must project an image of success, at all times. He smiles, then opens his menu. Carolyn picks hers up mechanically, but continues to stare at him, enraptured, a fervent Christian who's just come face to face with Jes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky stands with his DIGICAM, videotaping something on t ground at his feet. On VIDEO: A DEAD BIRD lays on the ground, decomposing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? On VIDEO: The camera JERKS up to discover Jane and Angela staring at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was filming this dead bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's beautiful. On VIDEO: Angela looks at Jane, trying not to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe you forgot your medication today, mental boy. On VIDEO: She falls out of frame as we ZOOM toward Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Look. I want you to stop filming me. Ricky lowers the Digicam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He looks at her, curious, his eyes searching hers. She doesn't look away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whatever. (to Jane) This is boring. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricky) Do you need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jane) Are you crazy? I don't want to end up hacked to pieces in a dumpster somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'll walk. But thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, see? He doesn't want to go anyway. C'mon, let's go. Angela starts off, but Jane doesn't follow. Ricky smiles her. She almost smiles back, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls off to Angela) I think I'm going to walk, too. Angela stops and stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Jane, that's like, almost a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn's Mercedes is parked next to a JAGUAR CONVERTIBLE with a VANITY LICENSE PLATE that reads "R E KING."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn and Buddy are in the middle of sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Oh, God! I love it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like getting nailed by the king?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes! I love it! Fuck me, your majesty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester's TOYOTA CAMRY cruises through the streets. We hea Lester SINGING along to "AMERICAN WOMAN" on the STEREO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester is driving, smoking a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester continues singing along to "AMERICAN WOMAN," as th Camry pulls into the parking lot of a FAST FOOD RESTAURAN Lester pulls up to the drive-thru speaker box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speaker box) Smile you're at Mr. Smiley's. Lester turns down the volume on the stereo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to try our new bacon and egg fajita just a dollar twenty-nine for a limited time only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... no. But thank you. (reading menu) I'll have a Big Barn Burger, Smiley fries, and an orange soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please drive up to the window, thank you. He pulls the car around to the WINDOW, where a teenage GI wearing a headset is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile, you're at Mr. Smiley's, that'll be four eighty-nine, please. Lester pays her. As she hands him his food, he notices a in the corner of the window that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like some Smiley Sauce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, actually... I'd like to fill out an application. She stares at him, confused by his age and attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not jobs for manager, it's just for counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm looking for the least possible amount of responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester sits at a booth with the MANAGER, a greasy kid wea a white short sleeve shirt and a tie covered with the Mr. Smiley's logo. He looks over Lester's application, baffle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you'd fit in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have fast food experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like twenty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sure there have been amazing technological advances in the industry, but surely you have some sort of training process. It seems unfair to presume I won't be able to learn. The Manager sighs and runs a hand through his greasy hair wondering what he could possibly have done to deserve thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn and Buddy are in bed, post-sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was exactly what I needed. The royal treatment, so to speak. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so stressed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I do when I feel like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fire a gun. Carolyn sits up, eager to learn from the master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intrigued) Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I go to this little firing range downtown, and I just pop off a few rounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I've never fired a gun before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've gotta try it. Nothing makes you feel more powerful. (smiles seductively) Well, almost nothing. Carolyn is quick to pick up her cue and kisses him, ready another round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Jane walk along without speaking. He seems comfortable with the silence; she doesn't. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do you like your new house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people who used to live there fed these stray cats, so they were always around, and it drove my mother nuts. And then she cut down their tree. An automobile FUNERAL PROCESSION appears and begins to pa them slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever known anybody who died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (a beat) Have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I did see this homeless woman who froze to death once. Just laying there on the sidewalk. She looked really sad. They watch the FUNERAL CARS pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got that homeless woman on video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you film that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it was amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was amazing about it? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you see something like that, it's like God is looking right at you, just for a second. And if you're careful, you can look right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, staring off into space as if hypnotized. Behind her, Ricky enters, followe Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I want you to meet somebody. (no response) Mom. Barbara's eyes flutter and she turns to him slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasant) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to meet somebody. This is Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my. I apologize for the way things look around here. Jane glances around. The room is spotless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR KEYS TURNING in the lock, then the door opens and Ricky enters, holding a RING OF KEYS, followed by Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where my dad hides out. GLASS CASES filled with GUNS line the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it he's got a thing for guns. Ricky crosses to a built-in CABINET behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to see this one thing... He unlocks the cabinet and opens it, revealing shelves stacked with WAR MEMORABILIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad would kill me if he knew I was in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you steal his keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. One of my clients is a locksmith. He was short on cash one night, so I let him pay me in trade. He reaches into the cabinet and carefully removes an oval CHINA PLATTER, which he hands to Jane. She examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it over. CLOSE on the bottom of the plate: A small SWASTIKA is imprinted in the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like official state china of the Third Reich. There's a whole subculture of people who collect this Nazi shit. But my dad just has this one thing. He puts the platter back into the cabinet and shuts the d then notices Jane looking at him oddly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) No, you're scared of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not. But she is. Ricky studies her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see the most beautiful thing I've ever filmed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On VIDEO: We're in an empty parking lot on a cold, gray d Something is floating across from us... it's an empty, wrinkled, white PLASTIC BAG. We follow it as the wind car it in a circle around us, sometimes whipping it about violently, or, without warning, sending it soaring skywar then letting it float gracefully down to the ground... Jane and Ricky sit on the bed, watching his WIDE-SCREEN T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was one of those days when it's a minute away from snowing. And there's this electricity in the air, you can almost hear it, right? And this bag was just... dancing with me. Like a little kid begging me to play with it. For fifteen minutes. That's the day I realized that there was this entire life behind things, and this incredibly benevolent force that wanted me to know there was no reason to be afraid. Ever. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video's a poor excuse, I know. But it helps me remember... I need to remember... Now Jane is watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant) Sometimes there's so much beauty in the world I feel like I can't take it... and my heart is going to cave in. After a moment, Jane takes his hand. Then she leans in an kisses him softly on the lips. His eyes scan hers, curiou see how she reacts to this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Oh my God. What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester sits at the table in sloppy clothes, eating his di voraciously and drinking beer from a bottle. Across from Carolyn picks at her food, watching him with contempt. EA LISTENING MUSIC plays on the STEREO.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We HEAR the back door SLAM, then Jane enters and quickly takes her seat at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overly cheerful) No, no, that's quite all right, dear. Your father and I were just discussing his day at work. (to Lester) Why don't you tell our daughter about it, honey? Jane stares at both her parents, apprehensive. Lester loo at Carolyn darkly, then flashes a "you-asked-for-it" grin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janie, today I quit my job. And then I told my boss to fuck himself, and then I blackmailed him for almost sixty thousand dollars. Pass the asparagus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father seems to think this kind of behavior is something to be proud of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your mother seems to prefer I go through life like a fucking prisoner while she keeps my dick in a mason jar under the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ashen) How dare you speak to me that way in front of her? And I marvel that you can be so contemptuous of me, on the same day that you lose your job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose it? I didn't lose it. It's not like, "Oops, where'd my job go?" I quit. Someone pass me the asparagus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Oh! And I want to thank you for putting me under the added pressure of being the sole breadwinner now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already have a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not stopping) No, no, don't give a second thought as to who's going to pay the mortgage. We'll just leave it all up to Carolyn. You mean, you're going to take care of everything now, Carolyn? Yes. I don't mind. I really don't. You mean, everything? You don't mind having the sole responsibility, your husband feels he can just quit his job--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Will someone pass me the fucking asparagus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises) Okay, I'm not going to be a part of this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (means it) Sit down. Jane does so, surprised and intimidated by the power in h voice. Lester gets up, crosses to the other side of the t to get a PLATE OF ASPARAGUS, then sits again as he serves himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick and tired of being treated    like I don't exist. You two do whatever    you want to do whenever you want to do    it and I don't complain. All I want is the    same courtesy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Oh, you don't complain? Oh, excuse me. Excuse me. I must be psychotic then, if you don't complain. What is this?! Am I locked away in a padded cell somewhere, hallucinating? That's the only explanation I can think of-- Lester hurls the plate of asparagus against the wall with such force it SHATTERS, frightening Carolyn and Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casual) Don't interrupt me, honey.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He goes back to eating his meal, as if nothing unusual ha happened. Carolyn sits in her chair, shivering with rage. Jane just stares at the plate in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and another thing. From now on, we're going to alternate our dinner music. Because frankly, and I don't think I'm alone here, I'm really tired of this Lawrence Welk shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane is sitting on her bed. There is a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, please let me in. Jane rolls her eyes, crosses to the door and lets Carolyn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish that you hadn't witnessed that awful scene tonight. But in a way, I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, so I could see what freaks you and Dad really are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? She stares at Jane, then starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Christ, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearful) No, I'm glad because you're old enough now to learn the most important lesson in life: you cannot count on anyone except yourself. (sighs) You cannot count on anyone except yourself. It's sad, but true, and the sooner you learn it, the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mom, I really don't feel like having a Kodak moment here, okay? Carolyn suddenly SLAPS Jane, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ungrateful little brat. Just look at everything you have. When I was your age, I lived in a duplex. We didn't even have our own house. Embarrassed, she quickly leaves. Jane looks in a mirror a rubs her cheek, then crosses to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane's POV: We're across from Ricky's room, looking in. H stands at the window with his DIGICAM, videotaping us. On WIDE-SCREEN TV behind him, we see Jane standing in her wi as she looks across at him. She waves. Ricky just keeps videotaping. A beat, then she starts to take off her shir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're behind Ricky as he videotapes Jane in her window. S has now removed her shirt. She stands there in her bra, t reaches behind her back to unhook the bra. On VIDEO: We ZOOM toward her as she takes off her bra clumsily. She's obviously embarrassed, but she's gone thi far and there's no turning back. She stands there with he breasts exposed, trying to look defiant, but she's aching vulnerable... Suddenly, the door is thrown open and the Colonel enters, incensed. Startled, Ricky turns around. As soon as his ey meet his father's, he knows what's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little bastard-- Ricky scrambles to dodge his father, but the Colonel is t fast; he punches Ricky in the face, knocking him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her window, Jane watches, pulling the drapes in fron her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane's POV: In the WINDOW across from us, the Colonel proceeds to give Ricky a serious beating, punching his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky's lip is bleeding, but he maintains a steady gaze a his father during this violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unnerved) How!? How?! C'mon, get up! Fight back, you little pussy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. I won't fight you. The Colonel grabs him by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked the lock, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you looking for? Money? Are you on dope again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. I wanted to show my girlfriend your Nazi plate. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. She lives next door. The Colonel glances toward the window. His POV: In the WINDOW across from us, Jane peeks out fro behind the drape. She quickly pulls it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Jane. A beat. The Colonel is suddenly, deeply shamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for your own good, boy. You have no respect for other people's things, for authority, for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just go around doing whatever you feel like, you can't--there are rules in life--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need structure, you need discipline--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneous) Discipline. Yes, sir, thank you for trying to teach me. Don't give up on me, Dad. The Colonel stands, still breathing heavily. Tenderness f his face, and he reaches out to touch Ricky's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Ricky... But something keeps him from doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay out of there. He leaves. Ricky gets up and goes to his bureau. He looks his reflection in the mirror, calmly takes a cloth and st to wipe the blood from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In darkness, we HEAR repetitive GUNSHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn, wearing PROTECTIVE HEADGEAR, is holding a GLOCK AUTOMATIC REVOLVER with both hands, FIRING it directly at She empties a round and stands there, exhilarated. An ATTENDANT approaches with a new round of ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loading gun) I gotta say, Mrs. Burnham, when you first came here I thought you would be hopeless. But you're a natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all I know is... I love shooting this gun! And she starts FIRING again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Darin sings "DON'T RAIN ON MY    PARADE" on the RAD Carolyn SINGS along as she drives.    Her face has lost i usual resolute determination; she's    actually enjoying spontaneously, and the lack of her    usual self-consciou allows us to see just how beautiful    she is. ANGLE ON the GLOCK 19 sitting on the passenger seat amids some CDs. Carolyn takes the gun and holds it at arm's length, admir it as she continues to SING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes turns onto Robin Hood Trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn's POV: We turn into the Burnham driveway. A 1970 PONTIAC FIREBIRD with racing stripes blocks our access to garage. CLOSE on Carolyn: She doesn't like having things in her w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester's REMOTE-CONTROLLED MODEL JEEP is zooming across t floor of the family room, expertly maneuvering corners an narrowly avoiding crashing. Lester is sprawled on the couch in his underwear, drinkin BEER and controlling the car. His working out is beginnin produce results. The room, too, seems changed: sloppier, lived in. Carolyn enters through the kitchen, flushed and angry. Sh just stands there, staring at Lester. After a moment, he looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, whose car is that out front?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine. 1970 Pontiac Firebird. The car I always wanted and now I have it. I rule!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Camry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I traded it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you have consulted me first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, let me think... No. You never drove it. (then) Have you done something different? You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brusque) Where's Jane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane not home. We have the whole house to ourselves. He smiles at her playfully. She stares back, annoyed. It' the same look she had at the beginning, when he dropped h briefcase, but whatever power that look had is gone. Lest just LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Carolyn. When did you become so... joyless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Joyless?! I am not joyless! There happens to be a lot about me that you don't know, mister smarty man. There is plenty of joy in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning toward her) Whatever happened to that girl who used to fake seizures at frat parties when she got bored? And who used to run up to the roof of our first apartment building to flash the traffic helicopters? Have you totally forgotten about her? Because I haven't. His face is close to hers, and suddenly the atmosphere is charged. She pulls back automatically, but it's clear she drawn to him. He smiles, and moves even closer, holding h beer loosely balanced. Then, just before their lips meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Lester. You're going to spill beer on the couch. She's immediately sorry she said it, but it's too late. H smile fades, and the moment is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? It's just a couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a four thousand dollar sofa upholstered in Italian silk. This is not "just a couch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a couch! He stands and gestures toward all the things in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't life. This is just stuff. And it's become more important to you than living. Well, honey, that's just nuts. Carolyn stares at him, on the verge of tears, then turns walks out of the room before he can see her cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after her) I'm only trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On VIDEO: Jane lays in Ricky's bed, wearing a tank top. S glances at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shy) Don't. We're watching the WIDE-SCREEN TV in Ricky's room. A CORD leads from the TV to Ricky's DIGICAM. Ricky holds camera, sitting naked in a chair. It's been almost a mont since his father beat him up, and there are still slight SCARS on his face. He's aiming his camera at Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: image on TV) It's weird, watching myself. I don't like how I look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you don't know how beautiful you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to sit here for that shit. She gets out of bed, takes his Digicam and focuses it on We see his image on the TV as she videotapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. How does it feel now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't feel naked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. Jane ZOOMS in on his face, which remains placid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about being in the hospital. Ricky smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was fifteen, my dad caught me smoking dope. He totally freaked and decided to send me to military school. I told you his whole thing about structure and discipline, right? (laughs) Well, of course, I got kicked out. Dad and I had this huge fight, and he hit me... and then the next day at school, some kid made a crack about my haircut, and... I just snapped. I wanted to kill him. And I would have. Killed him. If they hadn't pulled me off. (then) That's when my dad put me in the hospital. Then they drugged me up and left me in there for two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You must really hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a bad man. He grabs a half-smoked JOINT from an ashtray and lights i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... you better believe I'd hate my father if he did something like that to me. (laughs) Wait. I do hate my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? He passes her the joint, then takes the Digicam and focus it on her. We see her image on the TV as he videotapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a total asshole and he's got this crush on my friend Angela and it's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd rather he had the crush on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gross, no! But it'd be nice if I was anywhere near as important to him as she is. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you think my dad's harmless, but you're wrong. He's doing massive psychological damage to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? Jane looks into the camera, a loopy, stoned grin on her f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now, I too need structure. A little fucking discipline. They LAUGH. She lays back on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, though. How could he not be damaging me? I need a father who's a role model, not some horny geek-boy who's gonna spray his shorts whenever I bring a girlfriend home from school. (snorts) What a lame-o. Somebody really should put him out of his misery. Her mind wanders for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to kill him for you? Jane looks at him and sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) It'll cost you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've been baby-sitting since I was about ten. I've got almost three thousand dollars. 'Course, I was saving it up for a boob job. She stands and sticks out her breasts, then falls back on bed, LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my tits can wait, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that's not a very nice thing to do, hiring somebody to kill your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I'm just not a very nice girl, then, am I? She smiles dreamily at him. He turns the Digicam off and TV screen goes BLUE. He lowers the camera and looks at he intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly nervous) You know I'm not serious, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. He puts the Digicam down and joins Jane on the bed. A lon moment where neither of them speaks. He caresses her hair gazing into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how lucky we are to have found each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're FLYING above Robin Hood Trail. We see the BURNHAM'S HOUSE below us as we APPROACH it steadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember those posters that said, "Today is the first day of the rest of your life?" Well, that's true of every day except one. (a beat) The day you die. We're almost on top of the Burnham house now, as Lester, wearing sweatpants and running shoes, bursts out of the f door and dashes up the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're now at street level, as Lester runs toward us. He carries a WALKMAN and wears EARPHONES, and we HEAR ROCK M as he runs. The endorphins have kicked in, and Lester gri reveling in the sheer physical pleasure of his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blender GRINDS as Lester, still in his sweatpants, ma himself a high-protein shake. He's in excellent shape; ev his posture has changed, and he moves with the confident, easy swagger of an athlete. Jane watches him blankly from kitchen table. Carolyn enters. Lester leans against the counter, drinkin his shake directly from the blender pitcher, eyeing her. got a newfound sexual energy that makes her uncomfortable and he knows it. Carolyn quickly rinses off her coffee cu avoiding his eyes, and starts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, hurry up. I've got a very important appointment--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, is it okay if Angela sleeps over tonight? Jane looks at Lester to see how he reacts. He doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course, she's always welcome. (on her way out) You know, I thought maybe you two had a fight. I haven't seen her around here in a while. And she's gone. Jane continues staring at her father. Finally, he glances over at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) I've been too embarrassed to bring her over. Because of you, and the way that you behave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I've barely even spoken to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Dad! You stare at her all the time, like you're drunk! It's disgusting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry himself) You better watch yourself, Janie, or you're going to turn into a real bitch, just like your mother. Jane is stunned. She quickly rises, trying to get out of kitchen before she starts crying. ANGLE on Lester, and the immediate regret in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're outside Ricky's room, MOVING slowly toward the open door, through which we can see Ricky, standing at his bur mirror, combing his hair. The scars on his face are almos gone now. A REVERSE ANGLE reveals the Colonel standing outside the looking in, watching Ricky with great tenderness. Then Ri looks up at him, and the Colonel is suddenly self-conscio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brusque) You ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't need a ride. I'm going to go in with Jane and her mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky emerges from the house, followed by the Colonel, wh watches his son as he heads toward the Burnham house. His POV: Carolyn waves from the Mercedes, flashing an insincere smile. Jane leans forward from the passenger se and glares at us. As Ricky starts to get in the car, Lest emerges from the house in his sweatpants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Ricky. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty decent, Mr. Burnham. Ricky pulls his door shut, but not before Lester mouths " me" and Ricky gives a slight nod in acknowledgment.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the Colonel's face: he looks confused. As the Mercedes backs out of the driveway, Lester glances over at him. Lester's POV: The Colonel watches the car driving off, th looks at us. His face tightens. LESTER studies him for a moment, then grins and salutes before going inside the house. CLOSE on the Colonel, deeply troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open silently and the Colonel enters. He starts going through Ricky's bureau. He opens the DRAWER which we know Ricky keeps his marijuana, but he doesn't discover its false bottom. He stands and looks around, hi eyes finally landing on: The DIGICAM and a stack of CASSETTES on a shelf. The came is still connected to the TV. The Colonel turns on the TV, examines the Digicam and pre "play." The TV's blank screen suddenly gives way to... On VIDEO: Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, starin off into space. The Colonel watches, at first baffled, then impatient. He takes the cassette out of the Digicam and inserts another the TV screen we see... On VIDEO: Through the Burnham's GARAGE WINDOW, we see Les step out of his pants and briefs. Then, naked except for black socks, he grabs the dumbbells and starts lifting th watching his reflection in the window as he does... The Colonel sinks slowly onto Ricky's bed, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester, wearing a Mr. Smiley's uniform, is happily flippi burgers on a grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Lester, I need that Super Smiley with cheese, A.S.A.P.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need more than that, my little hombre.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lester looks up suddenly when he HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speakers) What's good here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speakers) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speakers) Then I guess we'll just have to be bad, won't we? (then) I think I'll have a double Smiley Sandwich and curly fries, and a vanilla shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speakers) Make that two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speakers) Please drive around thank you. Lester's face darkens, then... he smiles. He puts his spa down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes pulls around to the DRIVE-THRU WINDOW. Carol drives; Buddy sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we deserve a little junk food, after the workout we had this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nuzzles her neck) I'm flattered. They are too involved with each other to notice Lester watching them from the drive-thru window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overly cheerful) Smile! You're at Mr. Smiley's! Carolyn almost jumps out of her skin.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lester leans out of the drive-thru window, grinning at he holding bags filled with fast food. The Counter Girl stan next to him, staring blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to    try our new beef and cheese pot pie on    a stick, just a dollar ninety-nine for a    limited time only? Carolyn struggles to appear nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Buddy) We were just at a seminar. (then, all business) Buddy, this is my--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband. We've met before, but something tells me you're going to remember me this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carolyn) Whoa. You are so busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered) You know, this really doesn't concern you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, Janeane is senior drive-thru manager, so you kind of are on her turf. (to Carolyn, quietly) So. This makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (miserable) Oh, Lester--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, it's okay. I want you to be happy. (then) Would you like Smiley Sauce with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester, just stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. You don't get to tell me what to do. Ever again.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Carolyn closes her eyes, defeated, then grabs the wheel, shifts gears and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is filled with ominous gray clouds. Wind whips garbage across the parking lot as Carolyn's Mercedes pull next to Buddy's Jaguar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn grips the wheel tightly, staring straight ahead. Buddy looks at her unhappily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I guess we should cool it for a while. I'm facing a potentially very expensive divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I understand completely. (sarcastic) In order to be successful, one must project an image of success. At all times. She regrets it the second it's out of her mouth, and turn him. He just looks at her sadly, then gets out of the car shuts the door. She starts to CRY. As before, she SLAPS herself, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. Stop it! She closes her eyes tight, trying to stop the tears, then suddenly SCREAMS as loud as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy's Jaguar speeds off, leaving the Mercedes alone in parking lot. We can still HEAR Carolyn's muffled SCREAMIN There is a sound of distant THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On VIDEO: We're watching the video Ricky showed Jane earl of the empty white PLASTIC BAG being blown about. The win carries it in a circle around us, sometimes whipping it a violently, or, without warning, sending it soaring skywar then letting it float gracefully down to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I could be pretty pissed off about what happened to me... but it's hard to stay mad, when there's so much beauty in the world. Sometimes I feel like I'm seeing it all at once, and it's too much, my heart fills up like a balloon that's about to burst...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're FLYING once again over Robin Hood Trail, ASCENDING SLOWLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then I remember to relax, and stop trying to hold on to it, and then it flows through me like rain and I can't feel anything but gratitude for every single moment of my stupid little life... (amused) You have no idea what I'm talking about, I'm sure. But don't worry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will someday.
